### addCodeGenPrepare() {#ad3c43a064022801bdca206ced049a0ff}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void AMDGPUPassConfig::addCodeGenPrepare ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Add pass to prepare the LLVM IR for code generation.

This should be done before exception handling preparation passes.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h/#l00138">138</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h">AMDGPUTargetMachine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp/#l01249">1249</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp">AMDGPUTargetMachine.cpp</a>.

### addGCPasses() {#a48a4ae24ee0bd478fa6dd7b8e10eb756}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool AMDGPUPassConfig::addGCPasses ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
addGCPasses - Add late codegen passes that analyze code for garbage collection.

Add standard GC passes.

This should return true if GC info should be printed after these passes.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h/#l00141">141</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h">AMDGPUTargetMachine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp/#l01306">1306</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp">AMDGPUTargetMachine.cpp</a>.

### addPreISel() {#a32809e50f5ee8ee63d2ea8e20c0db9aa}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool AMDGPUPassConfig::addPreISel ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Methods with trivial inline returns are convenient points in the common codegen pass pipeline where targets may insert passes.

Methods with out-of-line standard implementations are major CodeGen stages called by addMachinePasses. Some targets may override major stages when inserting passes is insufficient, but maintaining overriden stages is more work. addPreISelPasses - This method should add any &quot;last minute&quot; LLVM-&gt;LLVM passes (which are run just before instruction selector).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h/#l00139">139</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h">AMDGPUTargetMachine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp/#l01295">1295</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp">AMDGPUTargetMachine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createMachineScheduler() {#a1195605ebde16d30249261f2f9104c9b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::ScheduleDAGInstrs &#42; AMDGPUPassConfig::createMachineScheduler (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machineschedcontext">MachineSchedContext</a> &#42; C) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Create an instance of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs">ScheduleDAGInstrs</a> to be run within the standard MachineScheduler pass for this function and target at the current optimization level.

This can also be used to plug a new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineschedstrategy">MachineSchedStrategy</a> into an instance of the standard <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagmi">ScheduleDAGMI</a>: return new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagmi">ScheduleDAGMI</a>(C, std::make&#95;unique&lt;MyStrategy&gt;(C), /&#42;RemoveKillFlags=&#42;‍/false)

Return NULL to select the default (generic) machine scheduler.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h">AMDGPUTargetMachine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp/#l01312">1312</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-cpp">AMDGPUTargetMachine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isPassEnabled() {#a16f2b92989c6760a2447933b3c78a755}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::AMDGPUPassConfig::isPassEnabled (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt</a>&lt; bool &gt; &amp; Opt, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8ec1bf8d7b792ca9fac56f8514db18d2">CodeGenOptLevel</a> Level=<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8ec1bf8d7b792ca9fac56f8514db18d2a7a1920d61156abc05a60135aefe8bc67">CodeGenOptLevel::Default</a>) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if a pass is enabled given <code>Opt</code> option.

The option always overrides defaults if explicitly used. Otherwise its default will be used given that a pass shall work at an optimization <code>Level</code> minimum.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgputargetmachine-h">AMDGPUTargetMachine.h</a>.
